Director of Military Intelligence, M.1.2(a) forv/arde . (Sgd.)-C.F. TOD, Colonel, G.G.TRANSLATION . Prom: George Maratos, 6 Old Bourse Street, Alexandria. To: Izzat Jaafar, Kuwait, Persian Gulf. Date: 8th March 1940. L anguage: P ren ch I am in receipt of your letters of tie 1st and 8th ultimo, the contents of which I have carefully noted. RIFLBS I have already written to a factory to find out if they can obtain for us rifle Mod.98. Meanv/hile, I have found a quantity of this model v/hich have been used but re-conditioned, and I should be glad to know if you are interested in these. PISTOLS I can now supply you with BROWNING F.N. Cal.6,35 (WUM A. 26 l) at the price of £.5.5.0d. cif Kuwait; Cal.7,65 and cal. 9mm (WUM A.283 and 285 ) at the price of £6.0.0d. cif Kuv/ait. Also Police Model (A. 28?) cal. 7 ,65 and 9 mm at the price of £.7.0.0d. cif Kuwait. Awaiting your reply.d) SECRET IND In any further V r /', cottnminioiition on this subject, please quote No. E 1561/G and address —not to any •person by name, but to— M The Under-Secretary of State,” Foreign Office, London, S.W. 1. The enclosed copies of a letter and a telegram seen in censorship are forv/arded. (Sgd.) W.J. CAWTHORN Colonel, G.S.Prom: Izzat Mohamed Jaafar, A.I'. Secretary to H.H. The Rule ■Kwalir.-^ To: George Maratos, 6 Rue de 1’Ancienne Bourse Alexandria. Date: 8th February 1940, Language: French. Dear Mr. Maratos, I confirm my letter of 1st January, and am really surorised that I have had to wait so long without hearing from you. New Orders: I have written to^you at length regarding my conversation with the great personality of Nejd, and asked you to reply quickly, as the question is a very delicate one, and I must write in the near future to this personality. If you are willing to do this great vorj..., you must write and send me catalogues soon so that something can be done: if not, you must still write and ^ tell me^so that I know how to reply to the letters of this friend. It is obvious that the more rapid our communications, the better results we shall obtain. I am sending this letter by air hoping that you will receive it in a few days. Please reply as soon as you get this letter, and awaiting your reply, With kindest regards, (Sgd.) IzzatIzzat M. Jaafar A.D.C. & Private Secretary to H.H. The Ruler of Kuwait JL ! o / 194 KUWAIT PERSIAN GULP (Copy of v/riter's visiting card - tv/o copies of this v/ere enclosed for the addressee, and two copies for Monsieur Demetre E. Revithakis c/o Mr. Maratos wishing the recipients a happy Bairam etc.)

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 1673/40 'Activities of ADC to Shaikh of Kuwait'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 13; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains translated correspondence sent between Izzat Mohamed Jaafar, the Aide-de-Camp and Private Secretary to the Shaikh of Kuwait, and George Maratos of Alexandria. The correspondence relates to the activities of Jaafar, in particular his negotiations over the purchase of arms, and was intercepted by the Middle East Intelligence Centre. Folio 9 is written in French.

name.namePart: Aide-de-Camp and Private Secretary to the Emir of Kuwait
